sen.j: 清水谷 公考（しみずだに きんなる、弘化2年9月6日 (旧暦)（1845年10月6日） - 明治15年（1882年）12月31日）は、幕末の公家。
sen.e: Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI (October 6, 1845-December 31, 1582) was kuge (court noble) who lived in the end of the Edo period.
Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI (October 6, 1845-December 31, 1882) was kuge (a court noble) who lived in the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 年号ミス訂正、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI (October 6, 1845-December 31, 1882) was kuge (a court noble) who lived in the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 公卿・清水谷公正の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Kinnao SHIMIZUDANI who was Kugyo (the top court officials).
He was a son of Kinnao SHIMIZUDANI who was Kugyo (the top court officials).
He was a son of Kinnao SHIMIZUDANI who was Kugyo (the top court officials).

sen.j: 箱館府知事。
sen.e: He was the governor of Hakodate-fu.
He was the governor of Hakodate-fu.
He was the governor of Hakodate-fu.

sen.j: 幼い頃に出家して比叡山に入るが、清水谷家を継ぐことになったため還俗。
sen.e: He became a priest in his childhood and entered Mt.Hiei, but he returned to secular life because he had to succeed the Shimizudani family.
He became a priest in his childhood and entered Mt.Hiei, but he returned to secular life because he had to succeed the Shimizudani family.
He became a priest in his childhood and entered Mt.Hiei, but he returned to secular life because he had to succeed the Shimizudani family.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）に従五位下を授受。
sen.e: In 1858 he was conferred to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 1858 he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 1858 he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）に侍従を申し付けられた。
sen.e: In 1862 he was appointed to jiju (a chamberlain).
In 1862 he was appointed jiju (a chamberlain).
In 1862 he was appointed jiju (a chamberlain).

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）に戊辰戦争が勃発すると、蝦夷地鎮撫を朝廷へ進言した。
sen.e: When the Boshin War began in 1868, he advised the Imperial Court to suppress Ezo.
When the Boshin War began in 1868, he advised the Imperial Court to suppress Ezo.
When the Boshin War began in 1868, he advised the Imperial Court to suppress Ezo.

sen.j: よって新政府より箱館裁判所総督に任命されて閏4月26日、旧幕府管轄箱館奉行より箱館において業務引き継ぎを行った。
sen.e: Therefore, he was assigned to the governor of Hakodate Court by the new government and succeeded operations from the former Hakodate bugyo (magistrate) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at Hakodate on June 16.

Therefore, he was assigned to the governor of Hakodate Court by the new government and succeeded operations from the former Hakodate bugyo (magistrate) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at Hakodate on April 26.
sen.cmt: 旧暦表示のままでいいということですので、原文のまま4月26日としました。
sen.e: Therefore, he was assigned to the governor of Hakodate Court by the new government and succeeded operations from the former Hakodate bugyo (magistrate) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at Hakodate on June 16.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に戻しました。

sen.j: 一行は少数だったが引き継ぎは至ってスムーズで、清水谷は旧幕府役人の希望者を下僚に用いた。
sen.e: His group consisted of small members but could succeed operations very smoothly, and Shimizudani adopted some old officers of bakufu who hoped to as new lower class officer.
His group consisted of a small number of people but could succeed operations very smoothly, and Shimizudani adopted some old officers of bakufu who hoped to remain there as new lower class officers.
sen.cmt: 「少数」の表現変更、複数化、remain thereを追加しました。
sen.e: His group consisted of a small number of people but could succeed operations very smoothly, and Shimizudani adopted some old officers of bakufu who hoped to remain there as new lower class officers.

sen.j: 箱館裁判所が箱館府に名を変えると共に箱館府知事に就任した。
sen.e: When the Hakodate Court changed the name to Hakodate-fu, he was assigned to the governor of the Hakodate-fu.
When the Hakodate Court changed its name to Hakodate-fu, he was assigned to the governor of the Hakodate-fu.
When the Hakodate Court changed its name to Hakodate-fu, he was assigned to the governor of the Hakodate-fu.

sen.j: 戦火はまだ及んでいなかったものの、蝦夷地警備の兵力は新政府に従わない東北諸藩にゆだねられていた。
sen.e: Although there was no fires of war at that time, the military force to guard Ezo depended on the clans in Tohoku who did not follow the new government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although there was no fire of war yet, the military force to guard Ezo depended on the domains in Tohoku who did not follow the new government.
sen.cmt: 単数化、at that timeを変更、藩をdomainに変更しました。
sen.e: Although there was no fire of war yet, the military force to guard Ezo depended on the domains in Tohoku who did not follow the new government.

sen.j: 孤立状態の蝦夷地には物資欠乏のおそれがあり、前途は困難であった。
sen.e: Therefore, Ezo could fall in the shortage of goods and had a lot of troubles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, isolated Ezo was threatened to fall in the shortage of goods and had a lot of troubles.
sen.cmt: 「孤立状態の」が抜けていたので、補いました。「おそれがある」の表現変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, isolated Ezo was threatened to fall in the shortage of goods and had a lot of troubles.

sen.j: そして同年10月20日、榎本武揚率いる旧幕府軍が蝦夷地へ到着した。
sen.e: On December 3, in the same year, the Old Shogunate Army led by Takeaki ENOMOTO arrived at Ezo.
On October 20, in the same year, the Old Shogunate Army led by Takeaki ENOMOTO arrived at Ezo.
sen.cmt: 旧暦表示のままでいいということですので、原文に従いました。
sen.e: On December 3 of the same year, the Old Shogunate Army led by Takeaki ENOMOTO arrived at Ezo.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に戻しました。

sen.j: 清水谷は兵力を峠下へ派遣し、やがて戦端が開かれ、箱館戦争が勃発した。
sen.e: Shimizudani dispatched troops to Togeshita and soon the Boshin War began.
Shimizudani dispatched troops to Togeshita and soon the Boshin War began.
Shimizudani dispatched troops to Togeshita and soon the Boshin War began.

sen.j: 箱館府の急造部隊は歴戦の旧幕府軍に敵すべくもなかった。
sen.e: The quickie troops of Hakodate-fu could not fight well with the Old Shogunate Army who experienced many campaigns.

sen.j: 清水谷は側近達を連れて異国船に乗船して撤退し、青森市へ落ちた。
sen.e: Shimizudani withdrew by a foreign ship with his close advisers and escaped to the Aomori City.

sen.j: 11月27日に青森軍総督に任命されたが、実際の軍事指揮は参謀の黒田清隆がとった。
sen.e: On January 9, 1869, he was assigned to the general of the Aomori army, but Kiyotaka KURODA, a general staff, actually controlled military missions.
On November 27, he was assigned to the general of the Aomori army, but Kiyotaka KURODA, a general staff, actually controlled military missions.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）4月28日、蝦夷地江差に布陣。
sen.e: On June 8, 1869, it lined up at Esashi in Ezo.
On April 28, 1869, the Aomori army lined up at Esashi in Ezo.
sen.cmt: 旧暦表示のままでいいということですので、原文に従いました。主語の明確化しました。

sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に戻しました。

sen.j: 旧幕府軍が5月18日に降伏すると、翌19日に箱館へ戻って政務に復帰し、戦後処理にあたった。
sen.e: After the Old Shogunate Army surrendered on June 27, he went back to Hakodate on the following day, 28, and returned to do government affairs including the treatments after the war.

sen.j: 同年7月には開拓使次官に就任し、ひきつづき蝦夷地の統治にあたった。

sen.j: 9月に東久世通禧長官が赴任してくると次官を辞め、箱館戦争恩賞として250石を賜った。
sen.e: When Michitomi HIGASHIKUZE was assigned to a director on October, he resigned the assistant director and was given 250 koku (45.09 cubic meters) as Onsho (reward grants) of the Hakodate War.
